sentences.english: Walking home by the alma mater is just for seeking fun.
sentences.chinese: 经过母校步行回家仅仅为了取乐而已。

sentences.english: The funny runner put the sun-glasses on the gun for fun.
sentences.chinese: 滑稽的赛跑者将太阳镜戴在枪上取乐。

sentences.english: How can you defend the killing of animals for pleasure?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能为杀死动物取乐的行为辩护呢？

sentences.english: For the last 4 months, my partner and I have been recreationally using heroin.
sentences.chinese: 上4个月，我的女友和我为了取乐而吸食了海洛因。

sentences.english: But other students often felled him at the fence class for fun.
sentences.chinese: 但其他学生常常在击剑课上把他砍倒来取乐。

sentences.english: Throw a ball at someone's head for fun in New York.
sentences.chinese: 在纽约，不可以把皮球扔到路人的脑袋上取乐。

sentences.english: The boys amused themselves by sliding down the banister.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们从楼梯扶手滑下以取乐。

sentences.english: One day， at a banquet in honor of distinguished guests， Cao bid Mi to work as a drummer， just to insult him for fun.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，曹操大宴宾客，让祢衡击鼓取乐。

sentences.english: People have been kicking objects around for fun since time immemorial.
sentences.chinese: 自古以来人们为了取乐就将身边的东西踢来踢去。

sentences.english: Harry delighted in pulling the dog's tail.
Families come too, to have picnics or have fun together in other ways.
sentences.chinese: 也有全家来玩的，野餐，或以其他方式一起取乐。

sentences.english: It is most often used recreationally for this effect.
sentences.chinese: 正是因为这些作用，它经常被用来取乐。
有些人以干荒唐事取乐。

sentences.english: Local residents have learned to adapt and have fun despite the cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 尽管天气寒冷，但当地居民已经学会适应并从中取乐。

sentences.english: Yesterday I went to the lake because it was very hot outside.
sentences.chinese: 昨天我取乐在湖因为外很热。

sentences.english: Yet for disport we fawn and flatter both.
sentences.chinese: 为了取乐，我们奉承低头。

definition: to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
lit. to eliminate worry and dispel melancholy (idiom); diversion from boredom/to dispel depression or melancholy/to relieve stress/a relaxing pass-time
practical joke/prank/to play a practical joke
to take liberties with a woman/to dally/to assail a woman with obscenities
